snippet: Organizations have been growing impatient because only two companies have signed onto a binding agreement on safety standards for factories in Bangladesh.
abstract: Pressure increases on retailers to improve safety in factories following Rana Plaza building collapse in Bangladesh that left as many as 1,000 dead; government officials, investors and religious groups warn retailers like Walmart, Benetton and Gap that they could face financial repercussions from consumers, damage to stock value or sustained public protests if they do not adopt stricter manufacturing standards.
lead_paragraph: Organizations have been growing impatient because only two companies have signed onto a binding agreement on safety standards for factories in Bangladesh.

headline.seo: Clothing Retailers Pressed on Bangladesh Factory Safety
headline.main: Retailers Are Pressed on Safety at Factories
headline.print_headline: Retailers Are Pressed On Safety At Factories

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
